results.title: Prospecting for petroleum
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, George Pal and Duke Goldstone
results.brief_description: An account of man’s never-ending search for oil. Opens with a dramatized survey of the importance of oil in modern industrial economy, followed by an account of how oil is formed in the earth’s crust. Methods used by early oil prospectors are compared with the magnetic gravimetric and seismic surveys used in the modern search for oil. An animated film.

results.title: Prospecting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Salesmanship”.
Explains that the foundations of successful selling is a systematic method of locating prospective customers. The methods of three successful salesmen are illustrated; one keeps his eyes and ears open through personal observation, one uses an initial sale to get a prospect for the next, and the third uses friends to give him additional contacts.

results.title: Prospect for a city
results.creator_credit: Harper Films, Alan Harper and Henry Cooper
results.brief_description: Edinburgh is an outstanding example of a planned city and this film was made to mark the bi-centenary of the plans of the first architect, James Craig. Today modern ideas of town planning are being incorporated in the old city of squares and vistas.

results.title: Proshchanie = The Parting
results.creator_credit: Mosfilm, A. Rasskazov, G. Sokolova and Elem Klimov
results.brief_description:
An old village in Siberia is to be destroyed and its peasant community, locked into ancient ritual, resettled in a development of faceless apartment blocks. Darya opposes the move, preferring to die rather than acquiesce, while her son works as foreman of the operation. The whole period from the announcement of the scheme to its completion is covered, presenting a conflict between the old order and the new, and a record of the price that has to be paid for progress. Larisa Shepitko, the wife of the director, was scheduled to direct this film but she and four other crewmembers died in a car accident on the first day of location shooting, July 2, 1979.

Credits: Producer, A. Rasskazov, G. Sokolova ; director, Elem Klimov ; writer, Larisa Shepitko, Rudolf Tyurin, German Klimov ; photography, Alexei Rodionov, Yuri Skhirtladze, Sergei Taraskin ; music, V. Artyomov, A. Shnitke ; editing, V. Byelova.
Cast: Stefaniya Stanyuta, Lev Durov, Alexei Petrenko, Leonid Kryuk, Vadim Yakovenko, Yuri Katin-Yartsev.

results.title: Prosecuting in the public interest
results.brief_description: The Office of the Commonwealth Director of Public Prosecutions was established in 1984 to provide an independent prosecutorial service under Federal law to the Australian Community. The office prosecutes crimes like drug smuggling and fraud and recovers the proceeds of crime from convicted criminals. This video provides an insight into the Commonwealth prosecution system in Australia by re-enacting two crimes, a heroin smuggling operation and a social security fraud, highlighting the interaction between the DPP and investigating agencies.

results.title: Prophet of truth
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Jesus teaching the crowds in the temple; the woman caught in adultery is brought before the Pharisees in the temple; Jesus disperses her accusers ‘let he who is without sin cast the first stone’; Jesus cures the Centurion’s servant; Jesus cures the blind man; Jesus confronts the Pharisees and condemns their hypocrisies; Barrabas kills a Roman soldier during a riot; Jesus talking to Nicodemus in the olive grove.

results.title: Prophecy: a case study in marketing research
results.creator_credit: Linda Jassim, Carol Dunn, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Disney Channel is shown consulting the marketing research company ASI to find out how best to place Disney in the cable TV market. Executives from the companies explain the four P’s of marketing - product, price, place, promotion - to be considered when planning a market strategy. Examples of different types of surveys and testing are shown, including phone surveys, focus groups and previews. There is a short explanation of how the data is tabulated, indexed, collated and evaluated, but it is stressed that, however valuable the research is, intuition and experience also play a major part.

results.title: Prophecy
results.creator_credit: Hiroshima-Nagasaki Publishing Committee Film Department, Kyushiro Kusakabe and Susumu Hani
results.brief_description: An anti-nuclear film with footage from recently declassified films and photographs from the US Archives graphically showing Hiroshima and Nagasaki after the atomic bomb explosions. Also includes scenes of the 1953 testing of a hydrogen bomb in Nevada. Focuses on the wounds, scars, radiation sickness, and suffering. Questions the American build-up of nuclear arms.
